_header: Truth it is that nobles lady lantern
Subjects: pageant verses; occasional verse; Catharine of Aragon; Arthur, prince of Wales
_description: ‘The speche of Vertu’ at the pageant celebrating the marriage of Prince Arthur to Princess Catharine — four stanzas rhyme royal

BLCottVitAXVI.First Lines: Trouth it is that noble lady katerynwithout me vertue will not accheved be…
BLCottVitAXVI.Last Lines: …hym shall ye mete with other mo electThat Toward your said Spouse shall direct
BLCottVitAXVI.Attributed Title: The spech of vertue within the said Castell (f. 187)
